883829065:
[

Technical director rail - Victoria

Company Name Mott MacDonald Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 53 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Our track record in transport dates back to the Melbourne underground rail loop in the 1980's. We are now involved in iconic projects such as Melbourne Metro Rail Tunnel and other Victorian rail projects.

Mott MacDonald is a dynamic and innovative management, engineering and development consultancy working on landmark projects worldwide. Wholly independent and employee owned, we have staff worldwide working in sectors including transport, energy, buildings, water, environment and advisory. Our business is truly global and offers exciting project opportunities within Australia and New Zealand, as well as within a range of offices and project sites across the globe.

Mott MacDonald is world-leader in rail infrastructure design and through this global expertise is involved in the delivery of major rail infrastructure projects across Australia and New Zealand.

Our Melbourne office is now seeking an experienced Rail Sector Lead to build and lead the Rail Team in Victoria and work collaboratively with other equivalent roles across ANZ business to help develop and enhance Mott MacDonald's brand in the rail sector. The successful applicant will be technically strong and capable of providing direct technical leadership of complex multi-disciplinary rail projects, as well as be able to build trusted relationships inside a range of client organisations.

The successful applicant will have the following skills and experience:

* Chartered engineer with ideally over 10 years' experience in the railways sector with a proven track record in leadership and delivery of consulting engineering services for multi-disciplinary rail projects within the full range of project delivery environments including concept, planning and detailed design
* Strong client relationships, ideally with local rail authorities and ARTC, with proven and trusted track record of delivering outstanding outcomes
* Ability to present rail capability and solutions to specialist rail clients
* Driven client-facing delivery style, focussed on achieving outstanding outcomes for clients, with strong communication skills and the ability to lead
* Established track record working with Contractors in D&C contracts an advantage
* Strong technical understanding of the full range of rail engineering disciplines including alignment design, signalling, comms and rail electrification.
* Strong inter-personal skills and ability to work collaboratively with broader rail group in the ANZ region and internationally
* Strong understanding of BIM and state of the art design modelling tools and practices.
* Strong commercial and contractual acumen.

In turn, you'll be working on significant projects like Melbourne Metro Tunnel and its supporting projects and other rail projects being pursued by the Victorian Government. You will build connections with our international expertise and bring this knowledge to our clients and to their projects. We adopt a pioneering mindset to meet our challenges head on.

There's no time like the present to make a change.

Seniority Level

Director

Industry

  • Civil Engineering

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Engineering

Assistant Director - Planning & Environment

Company Name Housing Industry Association (HIA) Company Location East Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 13 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The organisation

The Housing Industry Association is Australia’s peak residential building industry body. As a national industry organisation, HIA’s primary role is to represent and advance the interests of its members. We currently have an opportunity for an experienced town planner to join our Victorian team.

\xa0

The role

As the Assistant Director Planning & Environment you will enjoy a real opportunity to provide innovative policy advice and practice guidance to members of the Victorian housing industry. \xa0

\xa0

You will be responsible for providing professional advice to members on a range of environmental, planning and development issues. You will also be responsible for working closely with a range of government departments and industry stakeholders to put forward the housing industry’s position on policy and legislation. To assist in this, you will be required to research, develop and articulate relevant policy and strategies to advance the interests of the housing industry.

\xa0

You will attend a variety of meetings and business forums and prepare submissions to State Government and Councils on planning policy and related matters. You will also have the opportunity to prepare articles for publication, online information and deliver presentations for HIA members.

\xa0

You will provide key support to the Victorian Executive Director, HIA’s Planning and Environment Committee and be part of a national planning and building team.

\xa0

The person

To be successful in this role you will have an excellent knowledge of the Victorian planning approval processes, local government and state policy and legislation related to the home building and residential land development.

\xa0

The successful applicant will also possess outstanding communication skills, impeccable writing skills and industry appreciation to make this unique opportunity your own through professional advice and service to members. Ideally you will have completed a degree in a relevant discipline such as urban planning, environmental planning, or building and have several years of experience.


A full job description can be found in the Careers section of our website, hia.com.au.

\xa0

HIA employees enjoy a variety of benefits including the option to salary sacrifice up to two weeks annual leave, study assistance program, paid maternity leave and group insurance cover. HIA employees are also able to access HIA member benefits such as HIA Vehicles, HIA Telecommunications and Corporate Health Insurance Plans.

\xa0

If you are interested in joining the HIA team please submit your application by 1 October 2018 by clicking on the link to apply.

Job Description

The Department of Health and Human Services develops and delivers policies, programs and services that support and enhance the wellbeing of all Victorians. Our services are in line with the government's vision for making Victoria a stronger, more caring and innovative state. Our vision is to achieve the best health, wellbeing and safety of all Victorians so that they can live a life they value. We are building an inclusive workplace that embraces diversity of backgrounds and differences to realise the potential of our employees for innovation and delivering services aimed at enhancing the lives of vulnerable Victorians. The department is committed to the safety of its clients. The department takes a zero tolerance approach to abuse, including child abuse and abuse of people with disability. Departmental employees are required to comply with all legal requirements including the Child Safe Standards to keep children safe from harm and abuse. All jobs can be worked flexibly and we encourage job applications from Aboriginal people, people with disabilities, LGBTI and people from culturally diverse backgrounds. If you want a career within a department striving to make Victoria the best place to be and helping shape communities we all want to be part of, then we encourage you to apply. If you are an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander applicant, or if you have a disability, and require advice and support with the recruitment process, contact our Diversity Unit on DiversityInclusion@dhhs.vic.gov.au. The department has a zero tolerance towards violence within the workplace and recognises the rights of all staff to be free from violence and gender-related discrimination. We are proudly working with White Ribbon to create a safer workplace.

Number of vacancies available: 1

    To be successful in this role, you will need a demonstrated background in providing administrative support to an executive level manager. In one of our most senior consulting delivery roles – you will advise, design, develop and lead the implementation of complex cloud technology solutions that straddle both legacy, private and public cloud services.

These solutions deal with the major business processes or systems utilised to manage the overall enterprise. The task requires integrating hardware, processes, methodologies, and software within the customer environment.

Participates with the customer in the strategic design process and translates business needs into technical systems solutions. Responsible for the deployment, technical accuracy and completeness of integrated systems designs.

Principal Accountabilities
  • Implements technical solutions and management processes to achieve overall objectives by means of implementing systems or enterprise-wide solutions, using the company’s or a third-party’s hardware/software products and/or processes and methodologies.
  • Integrates solutions and strategies within the customer environment, based on the analysis of customer business goals, objectives, needs, and existing systems infrastructure.
  • Identifies additional product/services sales opportunities in customer organization.
  • Assists the sales organization and related Practice Areas as technical/industry subject matter experts.
  • Role requires expert skills and understanding of the industry best practices and methodologies relating to both public and private cloud solutions and services, including orchestration, automation, security and policy management.

Knowledge
  • Organisational expert within defined subject area (public and private cloud)

    • Industry experience

    • Relevant related disciplines

    • Contributes to strategic decisions affecting the discipline
  • Initiates new or revised departmental procedures, programs and initiatives

  • Pivotal Talent Acquisition Management Opportunity
  • Dynamic and Progressive Not-for-profit Healthcare provider

The Role

Epworth HealthCare is seeking a passionate Talent Acquisition Manager for this exciting and pivotal position.

This is an opportunity to lead the talent acquisition function for Epworth, partnering with key managers to develop and drive talent acquisition initiatives in line with the business objectives. You will be instrumental in delivering contemporary strategies and innovative talent acquisition offerings to support and drive the business objectives in line with the broader people and culture plan.

The position will suit a highly motivated, and enthusiastic individual with expertise in Health Professional recruitment, pipeline and high quality candidate management, who will-
  • Partner with key managers, candidates and other stakeholders to ensure that key current and future workforce requirements are met ahead of time and in line with budget.
  • Grow, manage and qualify Epworth's candidate pipeline in readiness for current and future vacancies, ensuring that a high quality of recruitment and candidate care is maintained; ensuring consistent messaging and branding into the market in line with Epworth's Employee Value Proposition (EVP).
  • With a focus on key strategic priority areas, engage and support recruiting managers and the business to offer an optimised, streamlined and efficient end-to-end recruitment process.
  • In partnership, guide the further enhancement of Epworth's recruitment service centre.

Epworth HealthCare is a world-class, not-for-profit, private health care group dedicated to providing the best possible outcomes for our patients by providing the best possible care. Across our eight locations patients and staff have access to state-of-the-art diagnostic, surgical and procedural technology, world-class theatres and equipment and benefit from the extensive teaching and research occurring at Epworth every day.

The Epworth Difference is defined by our unique culture and dedication to giving outstanding patient care. From the way we recognise and reward our staff to our attitude toward the patient experience, Epworth is for those with the ambition to get better, give the best possible care and lead their field.

Epworth is a great choice for staff who want to be part of a cutting-edge, fast paced and progressive environment.

Teacher

Company Name Goodstart Early Learning Company Location Sunbury, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 23 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Teacher – Sunbury – Ligar St

Goodstart is Australia’s largest early learning provider. As a not–for–profit social enterprise, we exist purely to improve the lives of Australia’s children and their families. Our people are our foundation, together we are working to ensure children have the learning, development and wellbeing outcomes they need for school and life.

We’re looking for an enthusiastic Teacher to develop programs and practices that are responsive to our children’s needs and aligned with the Early Years Learning Framework and National Quality Standard.

You will be part of our supportive culture and have access to a qualified mentor to support your professional development and growth.

Goodstart Early Learning Child Care Centre Sunbury - Ligar Street is in a conveniently accessible location, with proximity to a train station, shopping complex, and leisure and aquatics centre.

Our service caters for children from six weeks to five years. We maintain consistency among our staff, with the majority having worked at the centre for more than two years – and some for almost a decade! Several of our educators are bi- or multi-lingual, and speak additional languages such as Hindi.

Inside, all of the rooms - from Nursery to Kindergarten / Preschool - are all set up in line with an Early Years Learning Framework, with sensory and play based learning opportunities. Colourful, stimulating surrounds ensure the children have the chance to grow and develop through sensory, play-based learning.

The outdoor play area was specially designed to encourage interaction between the children, and utilises natural materials wherever possible. Many of the plants were planted by the children, who play a large role in their upkeep and care.

Your role
  • Hold a Bachelor of Early Childhood or equivalent qualification (ACECQA approved)
  • Hold a current First Aid qualification
  • Work in a purpose built and well resourced centre
  • 59 place centre with 4 rooms
  • Role is based in a 15 place 4 to 5 year room
  • Centre is offering a set middle shift
  • Centre has incursions and excursions in place
  • Plan innovative and engaging learning experiences
  • Champion positive and meaningful relationships with children
  • Full time, permanent role commencing immediately


Responsibilities
  • Assess children’s learning and development and apply pedagogical expertise to inform curriculum decisions
  • Maintain and apply expert knowledge of the National Quality Framework
  • Seek and share best practice examples to improve the education program
  • Build and maintain strong, positive relationships with families, children and the centre team
  • Model effective application of pedagogy in teaching practice
  • Contribute to a professional and positive work culture


The Benefits
  • Comprehensive induction and training programme
  • Access to a professional peer teacher mentor
  • Professional pedagogical and operational centre support teams to assist you in providing high quality educational programs.
  • Competitive above award wages
  • Quality teaching and Educational resources
  • Professional development and networking
  • Option to purchase additional annual leave
  • Discounted child care fees
  • Uniform allowance

If you have a Bachelor of Early Childhood Education or ACECQA approved equivalent qualification, and experience in a similar role, then we want to meet you!

Goodstart is committed to child safety, with a zero tolerance of child abuse, and expect all our employees to reflect this commitment. Should you strive to uphold and reflect these values then we would love to hear from you!

To apply for the role please ‘Apply Now’ or to review the role PD please

User Experience Designer

Company Name Timing Solutions Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 42 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We are a software and hardware company that look after Little Athletics and school sports results/data around Australia. We have some exciting projects that will benefit thousands of families, athletes and users across web development and native apps.


The ideal candidate will come from a UX background. They will become the product owner and work through our backlog of tasks, defining new projects, then assigning them to sprints. They will also effectively monitor and present project updates to the team and where necessary the clients.

Responsibilities

  • Design proof of concept new features/processes

  • Work with the developer and designer to create a workable specification

  • Determine the priority order of tasks and group into sprints

  • Test and validate the outcomes from the sprint

  • Monitor project deliverables

  • Update relevant stakeholders or team members on the project progress


Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience

  • Strong business acumen in project planning and management

  • Strong verbal, written, and organisational skills


If you thrive on challenges, being creative and can digest detail easily, then we look forward to hearing from you.


Please email info@timingsolutions.com.au with your resume and a cover letter giving us an insight into who you are and what makes you tick.\xa0 Also any examples of work you have done that help display your abilities.

884076278:
[

Lawyer - M&A, ECM and Corporate Law

Company Name Clarendon Lawyers Company Location Level 29 55 Collins Street, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 27 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Clarendons is a corporate specialist law firm.


We are a group of smart, straight-up, open and passionate people. \xa0


A team that takes pride in building long term relationships and delivering exceptional results.

We are experts in public and private M&A, ECM, private equity and venture capital, and general corporate and commercial law.


We are trusted advisers to leading Australian and international companies, private equity and venture capital funds, family offices and business owners across a broad range of industries and sectors.


Our clients benefit from our extensive experience, outstanding legal knowledge and skills, strong project management, effective negotiating and responsiveness. With Clarendons, our clients know they are receiving the very best legal advice – a team of dedicated and experienced lawyers is representing them.


The Opportunity


Due to sustained growth, the opportunity for Corporate / M&A lawyers to join our growing practice has arisen.


As a member of our practice you will work across the firm.\xa0 We want to engage you and provide an opportunity for you to grow and develop and undertake great work.\xa0 We take pride in our work and are unashamed of our success.\xa0\xa0


The firm offers candidates high quality work and training and mentoring by some of Melbourne’s leading corporate lawyers.


Recent transactions we have been involved in can be found on our website from the link https://clarendonlawyers.com.au/transactions/


What You'll Bring


To succeed in this role you will need

  • 3 plus years post admission experience from a Corporate / M&A practice.
  • A willingness and ability to build an understanding of clients and develop effective working relationships internally and with client groups.
  • A desire to grow as both a Lawyer and a leader.


What We'll Offer


At Clarendons, we’re focused on the success of our people. The success of our people leads to the success of the firm.\xa0


\xa0We commit to:

  • Providing fantastic work that will challenge you to be your best.
  • Providing a great work environment so you can do your best work.
  • Support and engage you in your professional growth and development as a lawyer and leader.
  • Competitive remuneration packages and flexible working conditions


How to Apply\xa0


Think you have what it takes? We would love to hear from you!\xa0 To apply online please click on the appropriate link above, or alternatively email recruitment@clarendonlawyers.com.au


Please note that right to work in Australia is a pre-requisite for the successful candidate.
